description: Fols. 200; 22.6 x 16.5 cm.; written surface 17 x 10-13 cm.; 21 lines to page; on glazed European paper; in naskhi; with catchwords; entries in red. A work containing the wonders of the world and creation and tales of the prophets. The prophets mentioned are Adam, Idrīs, Noah and his three sons, Hūd, Ṣāliḥ, Abraham, Moses, Aaron, Joshua, Elijah, David, Solomon, Jeremiah, Yūnus (Jonah), Zachariah, Yaḥyá (John), ʻImrān and ʻĪsá (Jesus). Beg.: بسم الله ... الحمد لله الذي انبت الخلق نباتاً وجعلهم Colophon: والحمد لله وحده وصلى الله على من لا نبيّ بعده. تم On the title page the book is described as ʻAjāʼib al-makhlūqāt and is wrongly ascribed to al-Māwardī, A.H. 450 [A.D. 1058]. MS in good condition; Arabic binding with flap. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900. ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), II, p. 23, III, p. 174; Rieu, Supplement of the catalogue of the Arabic Mss, 497-9; Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 1021/2.
author: Kisāʼī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd Allāh, 11th cent
